00007 #ifdef ZESTO_PARSE_ARGS
00008   if(!strcasecmp(alloc_opt_string,"DPM"))
00009     return new core_alloc_DPM_t(core);

00011 
00012 class core_alloc_DPM_t:public core_alloc_t
00013 {
00014   enum alloc_stall_t {ASTALL_NONE,   /* no stall */
00015                       ASTALL_EMPTY,
00016                       ASTALL_ROB,
00017                       ASTALL_LDQ,
00018                       ASTALL_STQ,
00019                       ASTALL_RS,
00020                       ASTALL_DRAIN,
00021                       ASTALL_num
00022                      };
00023 
00024   public:
00025 
00026   core_alloc_DPM_t(struct core_t * const core);
00027   virtual void reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb);
00028 
00029   virtual void step(void);
00030   virtual void recover(void);
00031   virtual void recover(const struct Mop_t * const Mop);
00032 
00033   virtual void RS_deallocate(const struct uop_t * const uop);
00034   virtual void start_drain(void); /* prevent allocation from proceeding to exec */
00035 
00036   protected:
00037 
00038   struct uop_t *** pipe;
00039   int * occupancy;
00040   /* for load-balancing port binding */
00041   int * port_loading;
00042 
00043   static const char *alloc_stall_str[ASTALL_num];
00044 };
00045 
00046 const char *core_alloc_DPM_t::alloc_stall_str[ASTALL_num] = {
00047   "no stall                   ",
00048   "no uops to allocate        ",
00049   "ROB is full                ",
00050   "LDQ is full                ",
00051   "STQ is full                ",
00052   "RS is full                 ",
00053   "OOO core draining          "
00054 };
00055 
00056 /*******************/
00057 /* SETUP FUNCTIONS */
00058 /*******************/
00059 
00060 core_alloc_DPM_t::core_alloc_DPM_t(struct core_t * const arg_core)
00061 {
00062   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = arg_core->knobs;
00063   core = arg_core;
00064   int i;
00065 
00066   if(knobs->alloc.depth <= 0)
00067     fatal("allocation pipeline depth must be > 0");
00068   if(knobs->alloc.width <= 0)
00069     fatal("allocation pipeline width must be > 0");
00070 
00071   pipe = (struct uop_t***) calloc(knobs->alloc.depth,sizeof(*pipe));
00072   if(!pipe)
00073     fatal("couldn't calloc alloc pipe");
00074 
00075   for(i=0;i<knobs->alloc.depth;i++)
00076   {
00077     pipe[i] = (struct uop_t**) calloc(knobs->alloc.width,sizeof(**pipe));
00078     if(!pipe[i])
00079       fatal("couldn't calloc alloc pipe stage");
00080   }
00081 
00082   occupancy = (int*) calloc(knobs->alloc.depth,sizeof(*occupancy));
00083   if(!occupancy)
00084     fatal("couldn't calloc alloc occupancy array");
00085 
00086   port_loading = (int*) calloc(knobs->exec.num_exec_ports,sizeof(*port_loading));
00087   if(!port_loading)
00088     fatal("couldn't calloc allocation port-loading scoreboard");
00089 }
00090 
00091 void
00092 core_alloc_DPM_t::reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb)
00093 {
00094   char buf[1024];
00095   char buf2[1024];
00096   struct thread_t * arch = core->current_thread;
00097 
00098   stat_reg_note(sdb,"#### ALLOC STATS ####");
00099   sprintf(buf,"c%d.alloc_insn",arch->id);
00100   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total number of instructions alloced", &core->stat.alloc_insn, core->stat.alloc_insn, NULL);
00101   sprintf(buf,"c%d.alloc_uops",arch->id);
00102   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total number of uops alloced", &core->stat.alloc_uops, core->stat.alloc_uops, NULL);
00103   sprintf(buf,"c%d.alloc_eff_uops",arch->id);
00104   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total number of effective uops alloced", &core->stat.alloc_eff_uops, core->stat.alloc_eff_uops, NULL);
00105   sprintf(buf,"c%d.alloc_IPC",arch->id);
00106   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.alloc_insn/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00107   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "IPC at alloc", buf2, NULL);
00108   sprintf(buf,"c%d.alloc_uPC",arch->id);
00109   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.alloc_uops/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00110   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "uPC at alloc", buf2, NULL);
00111   sprintf(buf,"c%d.alloc_euPC",arch->id);
00112   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.alloc_eff_uops/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00113   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "effective uPC at alloc", buf2, NULL);
00114 
00115   sprintf(buf,"c%d.alloc_stall",core->current_thread->id);
00116   core->stat.alloc_stall = stat_reg_dist(sdb, buf,
00117                                           "breakdown of stalls at alloc",
00118                                           /* initial value */0,
00119                                           /* array size */ASTALL_num,
00120                                           /* bucket size */1,
00121                                           /* print format */(PF_COUNT|PF_PDF),
00122                                           /* format */NULL,
00123                                           /* index map */alloc_stall_str,
00124                                           /* print fn */NULL);
00125 }
00126 
00127 /************************/
00128 /* MAIN ALLOC FUNCTIONS */
00129 /************************/
00130 
00131 void core_alloc_DPM_t::step(void)
00132 {
00133   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00134   int stage, i;
00135   enum alloc_stall_t stall_reason = ASTALL_NONE;
00136 
00137   /*========================================================================*/
00138   /*== Dispatch insts if ROB, RS, and LQ/SQ entries available (as needed) ==*/
00139   stage = knobs->alloc.depth-1;
00140   if(occupancy[stage]) /* are there uops in the last stage of the alloc pipe? */
00141   {
00142     for(i=0; i < knobs->alloc.width; i++) /* if so, scan all slots (width) of this stage */
00143     {
00144       struct uop_t * uop = pipe[stage][i];
00145       int abort_alloc = false;
00146 
00147       /* if using drain flush: */
00148       /* is the back-end still draining from a misprediction recovery? */
00149       if(knobs->alloc.drain_flush && drain_in_progress)
00150       {
00151         if(!core->commit->ROB_empty())
00152         {
00153           stall_reason = ASTALL_DRAIN;
00154           break;
00155         }
00156         else
00157           drain_in_progress = false;
00158       }
00159 
00160       if(uop)
00161       {
00162         while(uop) /* this while loop is to handle multiple uops fused together into the same slot */
00163         {
00164           if(uop->timing.when_allocated == TICK_T_MAX)
00165           {
00166             /* is the ROB full? */
00167             if((!uop->decode.in_fusion||uop->decode.fusion_head) && !core->commit->ROB_available())
00168             {
00169               stall_reason = ASTALL_ROB;
00170               abort_alloc = true;
00171               break;
00172             }
00173 
00174             /* for loads, is the LDQ full? */
00175             if(uop->decode.is_load && !core->exec->LDQ_available())
00176             {
00177               stall_reason = ASTALL_LDQ;
00178               abort_alloc = true;
00179               break;
00180             }
00181             /* for stores, allocate STQ entry on STA.  NOTE: This is different from 
00182                Bob Colwell's description in Shen&Lipasti Chap 7 where he describes
00183                allocation on STD.  We emit STA uops first since the oracle needs to
00184                use the STA result to feed the following STD uop. */
00185             if(uop->decode.is_sta && !core->exec->STQ_available())
00186             {
00187               stall_reason = ASTALL_STQ;
00188               abort_alloc = true;
00189               break;
00190             }
00191 
00192             /* is the RS full? -- don't need to alloc for NOP's */
00193             if(!core->exec->RS_available() && !uop->decode.is_nop)
00194             {
00195               stall_reason = ASTALL_RS;
00196               abort_alloc = true;
00197               break;
00198             }
00199 
00200             /* ALL ALLOC STALL CONDITIONS PASSED */
00201 
00202             /* place in ROB */
00203             if((!uop->decode.in_fusion) || uop->decode.is_fusion_head)
00204               core->commit->ROB_insert(uop);
00205             else /* fusion body doesn't occupy additional ROB entries */
00206               core->commit->ROB_fuse_insert(uop);
00207 
00208             /* place in LDQ/STQ if needed */
00209             if(uop->decode.is_load)
00210               core->exec->LDQ_insert(uop);
00211             else if(uop->decode.is_sta)
00212               core->exec->STQ_insert_sta(uop);
00213             else if(uop->decode.is_std)
00214               core->exec->STQ_insert_std(uop);
00215 
00216             /* all store uops had better be marked is_std */
00217             zesto_assert((!(uop->decode.opflags & F_STORE)) || uop->decode.is_std,(void)0);
00218             zesto_assert((!(uop->decode.opflags & F_LOAD)) || uop->decode.is_load,(void)0);
00219 
00220             /* port bindings */
00221             if(!uop->decode.is_nop && !uop->Mop->decode.is_trap)
00222             {
00223               /* port-binding is trivial when there's only one valid port */
00224               if(knobs->exec.port_binding[uop->decode.FU_class].num_FUs == 1)
00225               {
00226                 uop->alloc.port_assignment = knobs->exec.port_binding[uop->decode.FU_class].ports[0];
00227               }
00228               else /* else assign uop to least loaded port */
00229               {
00230                 int min_load = INT_MAX;
00231                 int index = -1;
00232                 for(int j=0;j<knobs->exec.port_binding[uop->decode.FU_class].num_FUs;j++)
00233                 {
00234                   int port = knobs->exec.port_binding[uop->decode.FU_class].ports[j];
00235                   if(port_loading[port] < min_load)
00236                   {
00237                     min_load = port_loading[port];
00238                     index = port;
00239                   }
00240                 }
00241                 uop->alloc.port_assignment = index;
00242               }
00243               port_loading[uop->alloc.port_assignment]++;
00244 
00245               /* only allocate for non-fused or fusion-head */
00246               if((!uop->decode.in_fusion) || uop->decode.is_fusion_head)
00247                 core->exec->RS_insert(uop);
00248               else
00249                 core->exec->RS_fuse_insert(uop);
00250 
00251               /* Get input mappings - this is a proxy for explicit register numbers, which
00252                  you can always get from idep_uop->alloc.ROB_index */
00253               for(int j=0;j<MAX_IDEPS;j++)
00254               {
00255                 /* This use of oracle info is valid: at this point the processor would be
00256                    looking up this information in the RAT, but this saves us having to
00257                    explicitly store/track the RAT state. */
00258                 uop->exec.idep_uop[j] = uop->oracle.idep_uop[j];
00259 
00260                 /* Add self onto parent's output list.  This output list doesn't
00261                    have a real microarchitectural counter part, but it makes the
00262                    simulation faster by not having to perform a whole mess of
00263                    associative searches each time any sort of broadcast is needed.
00264                    The parent's odep list only points to uops which have dispatched
00265                    into the OOO core (i.e. has left the alloc pipe). */
00266                 if(uop->exec.idep_uop[j])
00267                 {
00268                   struct odep_t * odep = core->get_odep_link();
00269                   odep->next = uop->exec.idep_uop[j]->exec.odep_uop;
00270                   uop->exec.idep_uop[j]->exec.odep_uop = odep;
00271                   odep->uop = uop;
00272                   odep->aflags = (uop->decode.idep_name[j] == DCREG(MD_REG_AFLAGS));
00273                   odep->op_num = j;
00274                 }
00275               }
00276 
00277               /* check "scoreboard" for operand readiness (we're not actually
00278                  explicitly implementing a scoreboard); if value is ready, read
00279                  it into data-capture window or payload RAM. */
00280               tick_t when_ready = 0;
00281               for(int j=0;j<MAX_IDEPS;j++) /* for possible input argument */
00282               {
00283                 if(uop->exec.idep_uop[j]) /* if the parent uop exists (i.e., still in the processor) */
00284                 {
00285                   uop->timing.when_itag_ready[j] = uop->exec.idep_uop[j]->timing.when_otag_ready;
00286                   if(uop->exec.idep_uop[j]->exec.ovalue_valid)
00287                   {
00288                     uop->timing.when_ival_ready[j] = uop->exec.idep_uop[j]->timing.when_completed;
00289                     uop->exec.ivalue_valid[j] = true;
00290                     if(uop->decode.idep_name[j] == DCREG(MD_REG_AFLAGS))
00291                       uop->exec.ivalue[j].dw = uop->exec.idep_uop[j]->exec.oflags;
00292                     else
00293                       uop->exec.ivalue[j] = uop->exec.idep_uop[j]->exec.ovalue;
00294                   }
00295                 }
00296                 else /* read from ARF */
00297                 {
00298                   uop->timing.when_itag_ready[j] = sim_cycle;
00299                   uop->timing.when_ival_ready[j] = sim_cycle;
00300                   uop->exec.ivalue_valid[j] = true; /* applies to invalid (DNA) inputs as well */
00301                   if(uop->decode.idep_name[j] != DNA)
00302                     uop->exec.ivalue[j] = uop->oracle.ivalue[j]; /* oracle value == architected value */
00303                 }
00304                 if(when_ready < uop->timing.when_itag_ready[j])
00305                   when_ready = uop->timing.when_itag_ready[j];
00306               }
00307               uop->timing.when_ready = when_ready;
00308               if(when_ready < TICK_T_MAX) /* add to readyQ if appropriate */
00309                 core->exec->insert_ready_uop(uop);
00310 
00311 
00312             }
00313             else /* is_nop || is_trap */
00314             {
00315               /* NOP's don't go through exec pipeline; they go straight to the
00316                  ROB and are immediately marked as completed (they still take
00317                  up space in the ROB though). */
00318               /* Since traps/interrupts aren't really properly modeled in SimpleScalar, we just let
00319                  it go through without doing anything. */
00320               uop->timing.when_ready = sim_cycle;
00321               uop->timing.when_issued = sim_cycle;
00322               uop->timing.when_completed = sim_cycle;
00323             }
00324 
00325             uop->timing.when_allocated = sim_cycle;
00326 
00327 #ifdef ZTRACE
00328             ztrace_print_start(uop,"a|alloc:ROB=%d,",uop->alloc.ROB_index);
00329             if(uop->alloc.RS_index == -1) // nop
00330               ztrace_print_cont("RS=.");
00331             else
00332               ztrace_print_cont("RS=%d",uop->alloc.RS_index);
00333             if(uop->decode.in_fusion && !uop->decode.is_fusion_head)
00334               ztrace_print_cont("f");
00335             if(uop->alloc.LDQ_index == -1)
00336               ztrace_print_cont(":LDQ=.");
00337             else
00338               ztrace_print_cont(":LDQ=%d",uop->alloc.LDQ_index);
00339             if(uop->alloc.STQ_index == -1)
00340               ztrace_print_cont(":STQ=.");
00341             else
00342               ztrace_print_cont(":STQ=%d",uop->alloc.STQ_index);
00343             ztrace_print_cont(":pb=%d",uop->alloc.port_assignment);
00344             ztrace_print_finish("|uop alloc'd and dispatched");
00345 #endif
00346 
00347           }
00348 
00349           if(uop->decode.in_fusion)
00350             uop = uop->decode.fusion_next;
00351           else
00352             uop = NULL;
00353         }
00354 
00355         if(abort_alloc)
00356           break;
00357 
00358         if((!pipe[stage][i]->decode.in_fusion) || !uop) /* either not fused, or complete fused uops alloc'd */
00359         {
00360           uop = pipe[stage][i]; /* may be NULL if we just finished a fused set */
00361 
00362           /* update stats */
00363           if(uop->decode.EOM)
00364             ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.alloc_insn++;)
00365 
00366           ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.alloc_uops++;)
00367           if(uop->decode.in_fusion)
00368             ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.alloc_eff_uops += uop->decode.fusion_size;)
00369           else
00370             ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.alloc_eff_uops++;)
00371 
00372           /* remove from alloc pipe */
00373           pipe[stage][i] = NULL;
00374           occupancy[stage]--;
00375           zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] >= 0,(void)0);
00376         }
00377       }
00378     }
00379   }
00380   else
00381     stall_reason = ASTALL_EMPTY;
00382 
00383 
00384   /*=============================================*/
00385   /*== Shuffle uops down the rename/alloc pipe ==*/
00386 
00387   /* walk pipe backwards */
00388   for(stage=knobs->alloc.depth-1; stage > 0; stage--)
00389   {
00390     if(0 == occupancy[stage]) /* implementing non-serpentine pipe (no compressing) - can't advance until stage is empty */
00391     {
00392       /* move everyone from previous stage forward */
00393       for(i=0;i<knobs->alloc.width;i++)
00394       {
00395         pipe[stage][i] = pipe[stage-1][i];
00396         pipe[stage-1][i] = NULL;
00397         if(pipe[stage][i])
00398         {
00399           occupancy[stage]++;
00400           occupancy[stage-1]--;
00401           zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] <= knobs->alloc.width,(void)0);
00402           zesto_assert(occupancy[stage-1] >= 0,(void)0);
00403         }
00404       }
00405     }
00406   }
00407 
00408   /*==============================================*/
00409   /*== fill first alloc stage from decode stage ==*/
00410   if(0 == occupancy[0])
00411   {
00412     /* while the uopQ sitll has uops in it, allocate up to alloc.width uops per cycle */
00413     for(i=0;(i<knobs->alloc.width) && core->decode->uop_available();i++)
00414     {
00415       pipe[0][i] = core->decode->uop_peek(); core->decode->uop_consume();
00416       occupancy[0]++;
00417       zesto_assert(occupancy[0] <= knobs->alloc.width,(void)0);
00418 #ifdef ZTRACE
00419       ztrace_print(pipe[0][i],"a|alloc-pipe|enqueue");
00420 #endif
00421     }
00422   }
00423 
00424   ZESTO_STAT(stat_add_sample(core->stat.alloc_stall, (int)stall_reason);)
00425 }
00426 
00427 /* start from most recently fetched, blow away everything until
00428    we find the Mop */
00429 void
00430 core_alloc_DPM_t::recover(const struct Mop_t * const Mop)
00431 {
00432   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00433   int stage,i;
00434   for(stage=0;stage<knobs->alloc.depth;stage++)
00435   {
00436     /* slot N-1 is most speculative, start from there */
00437     if(occupancy[stage])
00438       for(i=knobs->alloc.width-1;i>=0;i--)
00439       {
00440         if(pipe[stage][i])
00441         {
00442           if(pipe[stage][i]->Mop == Mop)
00443             return;
00444           pipe[stage][i] = NULL;
00445           occupancy[stage]--;
00446           zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] >= 0,(void)0);
00447         }
00448       }
00449   }
00450 }
00451 
00452 /* clean up on pipeline flush (blow everything away) */
00453 void
00454 core_alloc_DPM_t::recover(void)
00455 {
00456   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00457   int stage,i;
00458   for(stage=0;stage<knobs->alloc.depth;stage++)
00459   {
00460     /* slot N-1 is most speculative, start from there */
00461     if(occupancy[stage])
00462       for(i=knobs->alloc.width-1;i>=0;i--)
00463       {
00464         if(pipe[stage][i])
00465         {
00466           pipe[stage][i] = NULL;
00467           occupancy[stage]--;
00468           zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] >= 0,(void)0);
00469         }
00470       }
00471     zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] == 0,(void)0);
00472   }
00473 }
00474 
00475 void core_alloc_DPM_t::RS_deallocate(const struct uop_t * const uop)
00476 {
00477   zesto_assert(port_loading[uop->alloc.port_assignment] > 0,(void)0);
00478   port_loading[uop->alloc.port_assignment]--;
00479 }
00480 
00481 void core_alloc_DPM_t::start_drain(void)
00482 {
00483   drain_in_progress = true;
00484 }

00487 #endif
